repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Network of independent abortion providers, allies, and individuals; founded through the merge of the National Coalition of Abortion Providers and the Abortion Conversation Project. Collection includes founding documents, newsletters, and promotional and printed materials from the Abortion Care Network. Acquired as part of the Sallie Bingham Center for Women's History and Culture.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Abortion Care Network Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Abortion Care Network Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2011, 2012.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions 2011-0047 and 2012-0169 are described in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Abortion Care Network is a network of independent abortion providers, allies, and individuals which began operations in July 2008. It was founded through the merge of the National Coalition of Abortion Providers (now dissolved) and the Abortion Conversation Project, which still operates as ACN's sister organization. The majority of ACN members are independent clinic owners and staff.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes founding documents, newsletters, and promotional materials from the Abortion Care Network, with items dating from 2007 to 2010 and undated. Acquired as part of the Sallie Bingham Center for Women's History and Culture.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The Sallie Bingham Center for Women's History and Culture also holds the records of the National Coalition of Abortion Providers and the Abortion Conversation Project, as well as the personal papers of Peg Johnston, a founding member of these groups.

did.unittitle: Abortion Care Network Records, 2007-2012 and undated
Founding documents and financials, 2008 and undated
